long: Meaning: a "ram" (as full-grown and fat), including a "battering-ram" (as butting); hence, a "meadow" (as for sheep); also a "pad" or "camel's saddle" (as puffed out).  Usage: captain, furniture, lamb, (large) pasture, ram. See also "H1033", "H3746".  Source: from "H3769" in the sense of plumpness;
